feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued August 21 at 4:49AM AKDT until August 21 at 9:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Coastal Baranof and Prince of Wales Islands. Including Sitka, Klawock and Craig. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKDT this morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:14PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 2:00PM AKDT until August 21 at 9:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Including the following area, Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 215 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 8:27AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Poinsett and southwestern Mississippi Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 827 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marked Tree, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 20 at 10:04PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 10 to 13 feet. * WHERE...South and east facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor. Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 6:06AM MST until August 21 at 7:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST THIS MORNING FOR GILA COUNTY... At 602 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated that rain has ended in the Tonto Creek basin including the Gisela area and near Jakes Corner. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain fell earlier this morning 3 to 6 miles northeast of Gisela. Flash flooding is likely ongoing in Tonto

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 6:00AM MST until August 21 at 9:15AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM MST THIS MORNING FOR GILA AND MARICOPA COUNTIES... At 600 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain in the vicinity of Apache Lake and just to the east. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 5:59AM MST until August 21 at 7:45AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM MST THIS MORNING FOR MARICOPA COUNTY... At 559 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has fallen across the area increasing flow within Sols Wash and Hassayampa River. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR CONNECTICUT... Due to moderate to severe drought conditions, ground fuels and soil moisture are very dry. This has lead to an increased potential for the development and spread of brush fires today.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued August 21 at 6:33AM PDT until August 22 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... .A disturbance crossing the area tonight is expected to result in isolated thunderstorms overnight becoming scattered during the day on Monday. Abundant lightning is a possibility... especially over the Blue Mountains and Wallowa County.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:54AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG MAY FORM OVER PARTS OF NORTH CENTRAL AND FAR NORTHEAST WISCONSIN EARLY THIS MORNING... Patchy fog is expected to develop early this morning, and may become dense in localized areas. Visibilities may drop to a half mile or less in spots. The fog will continue through 8 am or 9 am before mixing out.
